item.title: kkurtz add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "There is no was." -- William Faulkner

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Don't be 'a writer'. Be writing." -- William Faulkner

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Michael Faulkner
item.description: "Live up to your potential, not down to others expectation." -- Michael Faulkner

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "War and drink are the two things man is never too poor to buy." -- William Faulkner

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Pouring out liquor is like burning books." -- William Faulkner

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "With our thoughts we make the world." -- Buddha

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "Where there are humans, You'll find flies, And Buddhas." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "This is the way the world ends Not with a bang but a whimper." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Some editors are failed writers, but so are most writers." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Never play cards with a man called Doc. Never eat at a place called Mom's. Never sleep with a woman whose troubles are worse than your own." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "We are the change we have been waiting for." -- Barack Obama

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Walt Kelly
item.description: "We have met the enemy and he is us." -- Walt Kelly

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Any writer who knows what he's doing isn't doing very much." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "... Chicago divided your heart. Leaving you loving the joint for keeps. Yet knowing it never can love you." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Leo Dworken
item.description: " No amount of time can erase the memory of a good cat, and no amount of masking tape can ever totally remove his fur from your couch." -- Leo Dworken

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: kkurtz add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "As long as there are slaughter houses there will always be battlefields." -- Leo Tolstoy
